intro: Dorstenia gourmaensis, commonly known as the Gourma devil's backbone, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family native to western Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, twisted stems that resemble a spine, which is a key botanical feature. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are alternate and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its overall appearance. Dorstenia gourmaensis is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
